intro: Valerianella rhombicarpa, commonly known as the roundleaf valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are rhombic in shape, giving it its scientific name, and it is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Valerianella rhombicarpa is also a food source for certain insect species and can be found in gardens and wild areas.
